header: CNR No.MHPU01- 000301-2019 Manisha S. Pawar and another Vs. State of Maharashtra ( Paud Police Station )

background.text: Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No. 74/2018 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicants­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.08/2019, registered with Paud Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.7 of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988.

arguments.text: 2. Applicant/accused No.1 who is Talathi and applicant/accused No.2, who is also Government servant, made demand of bribe amount to the original complainant, therefore, he contacted to ACB, Pune, who by following due procedure, caught to the applicant/accused Nos. 1 and 2, while accepting bribe amount of Rs.50,000/­.

argumentSentences.text: Applicant/accused No.1 who is Talathi and applicant/accused No.2, who is also Government servant, made demand of bribe amount to the original complainant, therefore, he contacted to ACB, Pune, who by following due procedure, caught to the applicant/accused Nos. 1 and 2, while accepting bribe amount of Rs.50,000/­.

arguments.text: 3. Learned counsel for applicants/accused submitted that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicants/accused is not necessary. Therefore, they be released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: Learned counsel for applicants/accused submitted that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicants/accused is not necessary.
Therefore, they be released on bail.

arguments.text: 4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that investigation is yet to be completed and if applicants/accused are released on bail, there is possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence. Therefore, bail application be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: On the other hand, learned APP submitted that investigation is yet to be completed and if applicants/accused are released on bail, there is possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence.

arguments.text: 5. On perusing police papers, prima facie, it reveals that applicant/accused No.1 is Talathi of Bhugaon. She made demand of bribe amount to the original complainant for mutation of entry, therefore, complainant contacted to ACB, Pune, who carried raid and caught the applicant/accused Nos. 1 and 2 while accepting bribe amount of Rs.50,000/­. It seems that practically investigation is 2 completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is now not necessary, Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicants­ accused are released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: On perusing police papers, prima facie, it reveals that applicant/accused No.1 is Talathi of Bhugaon.

She made demand of bribe amount to the original complainant for mutation of entry, therefore, complainant contacted to ACB, Pune, who carried raid and caught the applicant/accused Nos. 1 and 2 while accepting bribe amount of Rs.50,000/­.

It seems that practically investigation is 2 completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is now not necessary, Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicants­ accused are released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicants ­accused No.1­Manisha Sarjerao Pawar and No.2­ Vitthal Gulab Surve, be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) each with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicants­ accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicants­ accused shall attend Anti­ Corruption Bureau, Pune, on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­ sheet. v. The applicants ­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicants ­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicants ­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case.

processedText:
CNR No.MHPU01- 000301-2019 Manisha S. Pawar and another Vs. State of Maharashtra ( Paud Police Station ) 
---header-ends---
Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No. 74/2018 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicants­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.08/2019, registered with Paud Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.7 of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988. 
---background-ends---
2. Applicant/accused No.1 who is Talathi and applicant/accused No.2, who is also Government servant, made demand of bribe amount to the original complainant, therefore, he contacted to ACB, Pune, who by following due procedure, caught to the applicant/accused Nos. 1 and 2, while accepting bribe amount of Rs.50,000/­. 
---argument-ends---
3. Learned counsel for applicants/accused submitted that practically investigation is completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicants/accused is not necessary. Therefore, they be released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that investigation is yet to be completed and if applicants/accused are released on bail, there is possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence. Therefore, bail application be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5. On perusing police papers, prima facie, it reveals that applicant/accused No.1 is Talathi of Bhugaon. She made demand of bribe amount to the original complainant for mutation of entry, therefore, complainant contacted to ACB, Pune, who carried raid and caught the applicant/accused Nos. 1 and 2 while accepting bribe amount of Rs.50,000/­. It seems that practically investigation is 2 completed, therefore, custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is now not necessary, Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicants­ accused are released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicants ­accused No.1­Manisha Sarjerao Pawar and No.2­ Vitthal Gulab Surve, be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) each with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicants­ accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicants­ accused shall attend Anti­ Corruption Bureau, Pune, on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­ sheet. v. The applicants ­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicants ­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicants ­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case. 
---order-ends---
Date : 07/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge,Pune 3 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. Gore, Stenographer Grade­I Court Name : K.D. Vadane , Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune Date : 07/01/2019 order signed by presiding officer on : 07/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 08/01/2019
